workflow_description: Navigate to Netlify homepage. Verify the hero headline contains 'The platform for modern web projects'. Find and click the 'Get Started' button.
master_plan:
# Master Test Plan: Netlify Smoke Suite ## 1. Domain Information **Target URL:** https://www.netlify.com **Business Domain:** SaaS (Software as a Service) - specifically targeting developers and businesses looking for a platform to build, deploy, and scale web applications. **Analysis:** Netlify is a platform designed to streamline the web development workflow. Key aspects include: * **Focus:** JAMstack architecture (JavaScript, APIs, and Markup). * **Core Services:** Continuous deployment, serverless functions, edge networking, and collaborative tools. * **Target Audience:** Web developers, front-end engineers, and digital agencies. * **Business Goals:** Attracting new users, retaining existing customers, and upselling features. * **Potential Risks:** Downtime directly impacts user deployments, broken features can hinder developer workflows, and security vulnerabilities could compromise user data. ## 2. Smoke Suite Definition **Objective:** Verify the core functionality of the Netlify website, ensuring it is operational and users can access critical features. **Scope:** * Website availability and basic functionality. * Core navigation and key landing pages. * A critical user flow: navigating to the homepage, verifying a key element (hero headline), and initiating the signup process. **Test Cases:** ### 2.1 Website Availability * **Test Case ID:** SMOKE-001 * **Description:** Verify the Netlify homepage is accessible and returns a successful HTTP status code (200). * **Steps:** 1. Navigate to https://www.netlify.com 2. Verify the HTTP status code is 200. * **Expected Result:** The homepage loads successfully and the HTTP status code is 200. ### 2.2 Core Navigation * **Test Case ID:** SMOKE-002 * **Description:** Verify the primary navigation links on the homepage are functional. * **Steps:** 1. Navigate to https://www.netlify.com 2. Locate the main navigation menu. 3. Click on the following links and verify they navigate to the correct pages: * "Platform" * "Pricing" * "Docs" * "Blog" * **Expected Result:** Each navigation link redirects to the corresponding page without errors. ### 2.3 Core Flow: Homepage & Get Started * **Test Case ID:** SMOKE-003 * **Description:** Verify the core "Happy Path" of landing on the homepage, seeing the hero headline, and clicking 'Get Started' * **Steps:** 1. Navigate to https://www.netlify.com 2. Verify the hero headline contains the text "The platform for modern web projects". 3. Locate the "Get Started" button (use `getByRole('button', {name: /Get Started/i})` if necessary). 4. Click the "Get Started" button. 5. Verify that clicking the button navigates the user to the sign-up page. * **Expected Result:** The headline text matches the expected value, the "Get Started" button is clickable, and the user is redirected to the sign-up page. ## 3. Strategic Mining Instructions These instructions guide the autonomous agents on what elements and pages to prioritize during mining. This is crucial for expanding the test suite beyond the initial smoke tests. **Prioritized Elements/Pages:** 1. **Homepage Hero Section:** * **Reason:** First impression, conveys core value proposition. * **Mining Instructions:** Extract all text elements (headings, paragraphs, links) and images. Identify all calls to action (CTAs) and their target URLs. 2. **Pricing Page:** * **Reason:** Critical for understanding the business model and potential revenue streams. * **Mining Instructions:** Extract pricing tiers, feature comparisons, and any interactive elements (e.g., cost calculators). Focus on links to "Start Free Trial" or "Contact Sales." 3. **Documentation (Docs) Section:** * **Reason:** Essential for user onboarding and technical understanding. * **Mining Instructions:** Explore the main landing page for the documentation. Identify key sections like "Quick Start," "API Reference," and "Tutorials." Prioritize links to code examples and configuration guides. 4. **Blog:** * **Reason:** Keep up to date on changes. * **Mining Instructions:** Look at Blog posts. Find categories. 5. **"Platform" Dropdown:** * **Reason:** Exposes the different sub-products. * **Mining Instructions:** Get a list of sub-products. **Data Extraction Strategy:** * **Prioritize text-based content:** Headlines, descriptions, error messages, form labels. * **Identify and extract all links ( tags):** Capture the `href` attribute and link text. * **Analyze form elements (
):** Identify input fields (text, email, password), dropdowns, checkboxes, and submit buttons. * **Capture image URLs ( tags):** Verify image alt text for accessibility. * **Look for dynamic content:** Elements that change based on user interaction or data updates (e.g., progress bars, status indicators). **Test Suite Expansion Guidance:** * **Based on Mining Results:** Create new test cases to verify the functionality of mined elements and pages. For example, if a new feature is highlighted on the homepage, create a test case to verify its functionality. * **Focus on User Flows:** Extend the "Happy Path" test case to cover more complex user scenarios (e.g., creating an account, deploying a website, configuring DNS settings). * **Consider Edge Cases:** Identify potential error conditions and create test cases to verify error handling (e.g., invalid form input, network errors). This Master Test Plan provides a solid foundation for building a comprehensive test suite for Netlify. The Smoke Suite ensures basic functionality, while the Strategic Mining Instructions guide the autonomous agents to discover and test more complex features and user flows.
